title.rendered: Learning about astrophysics on International Moon day

content.rendered:
Students from Sun Valley School and the Smile Foundation’s Mission Education centre in Noida came together to celebrate International Moon Day

The event featured an insightful session led by distinguished astrophysics experts, Dr. Suprit Singh from IIT Delhi and Dr. Bharti Arora, a researcher at the University of Liège. The session covered fascinating topics such as the moon-Earth distance, lunar phases, eclipses, and more, culminating in a telescope viewing of the night sky.

This event was part of the Child for Child programme, an initiative by Smile Foundation that engages schools across India. Through interactive sessions, the programme raises awareness among children about various social causes, helping them recognise their privileged status and fostering empathy for others.
